intro: Atragene pseudoalpina, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hair, helping to retain moisture in harsh climates. Atragene pseudoalpina is often found in meadows and slopes at high altitudes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
